intro: Meibomia triflora f. virescens, commonly known as the green-flowered meibomia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in cymes. The plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while the stems are often hairy. This variety is noted for its ornamental value due to its unique floral display and foliage.
